results.title: Lights, Camera, Weapons Check? Actors Worry After Baldwin Charges.
results.abstract: The manslaughter charges Alec Baldwin faces after a fatal on-set shooting revived questions about who’s responsible for gun safety on film productions. “We are not actual cowboys,” an actor noted.
results.byline: By Graham Bowley, Julia Jacobs and Marc Tracy

multimedia.caption: Alec Baldwin had been told the gun was safe to handle before he fatally shot the cinematographer of “Rust” while preparing for a scene.
multimedia.copyright: Santa Fe County Sheriff’s Office/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.title: In ‘M3gan,’ a Detective’s Guilty Laugh Speaks Volumes About Him (and Us)
results.abstract: What’s so funny about his inappropriate response to a boy’s injury? The director pushed to keep the bizarre moment in the film, for good reason.

multimedia.caption: A character’s awkward chuckle got the biggest laugh at a test screening of “M3gan,” the director said.
A character’s awkward chuckle got the biggest laugh at a test screening of “M3gan,” the director said.

results.title: Five Science Fiction Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: The intelligence may be artificial, but the thrills are real in this month’s collection of sci-fi picks.

results.title: Winning a BAFTA? Just One of Joanna Scanlan’s Career Surprises.
results.abstract: Last year, the British actress won for “After Love,” a melodrama she led after years of comedic roles and only getting her first acting job at 34.

multimedia.caption: Joanna Scanlan won a BAFTA for her performance in “After Love,” in which she plays a Muslim convert who discovers her late husband had concealed a secret life.
Joanna Scanlan won a BAFTA for her performance in “After Love,” in which she plays a Muslim convert who discovers her late husband had concealed a secret life.
Joanna Scanlan won a BAFTA for her performance in “After Love,” in which she plays a Muslim convert who discovers her late husband had concealed a secret life.

results.title: Alec Baldwin Charges Complicate Efforts to Finish Troubled ‘Rust’ Movie
results.abstract: A settlement with the family of the cinematographer who was slain on the set called for resuming production, with her widower serving as an executive producer.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Graham Bowley

multimedia.caption: The producers of “Rust” hope that Alec Baldwin will be able to complete the film despite facing charges in the shooting death of its original cinematographer.
The producers of “Rust” hope that Alec Baldwin will be able to complete the film despite facing charges in the shooting death of its original cinematographer.

results.title: What Will Be Nominated for Oscars on Tuesday? What Won’t Be?
results.abstract: It’s an unusually wide open year for the Academy Awards. But our expert has a good idea about what will make the cut. Here are his projections.

results.title: A Doll That Wears Sunglasses With Attitude? Oh, ‘M3gan’ Is a Gay Movie.
results.abstract: The title robot — reminiscent of the loyal but messy straight women that gay men are protective of — is progress for a genre with a shameful history.

multimedia.caption: The killer doll in “M3gan” is fashionable, knowing and cutting.
The killer doll in “M3gan” is fashionable, knowing and cutting.
The killer doll in “M3gan” is fashionable, knowing and cutting.

results.title: ‘Alice, Darling’ Review: That’s What Friends Are For
results.abstract: Anna Kendrick stars in a drama about a woman in an abusive relationship who finds refuge with two girlfriends during a getaway.

multimedia.caption: From left, Wunmi Mosaku, Anna Kendrick and Kaniehtiio Horn in “Alice, Darling.”
From left, Wunmi Mosaku, Anna Kendrick and Kaniehtiio Horn in “Alice, Darling.”

results.title: At the Movies, Bagels, Onions and a Side Dish of Nothing
results.abstract: Both “Everything Everywhere All at Once” and the “Knives Out” sequel delve into the abyss, where life has no meaning. What they do next is surprising.
des_facet: Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery (Movie)

results.title: ‘Room’ Will Be Staged on Broadway, Starring Adrienne Warren
results.abstract: Emma Donoghue adapted the show from her best-selling 2010 novel; she also wrote the screenplay for the 2015 film.

multimedia.caption: Adrienne Warren won a Tony Award in 2021 for portraying Tina Turner in the musical “Tina.”
Adrienne Warren won a Tony Award in 2021 for portraying Tina Turner in the musical “Tina.”

results.title: Edward Pressman, Film Producer Who Bet on Unsung Talent, Dies at 79
results.abstract: He took on Oliver Stone, Terrence Malick, Kathryn Bigelow and other directors just starting out. His name was on “Hoffa,” “American Psycho,” “Conan the Barbarian” and many more films.

multimedia.caption: Edward R. Pressman at his office in Beverly Hills, Calif., in 2001. He was producer or executive producer on almost 100 movies across a range of genres.
Edward R. Pressman at his office in Beverly Hills, Calif., in 2001. He was producer or executive producer on almost 100 movies across a range of genres.
Edward R. Pressman at his office in Beverly Hills, Calif., in 2001. He was producer or executive producer on almost 100 movies across a range of genres.

results.title: ‘The Wandering Earth II’ Review: It Wanders Too Far
results.abstract: The audacious sequel to Frant Gwo’s 2019 sci-fi blockbuster follows survivors working to avert planetary disaster, but it loses much of the glee of its predecessor.

multimedia.caption: From left, Wu Jing, Wang Zhi and Kawawa Kadichi in a scene from the sci-fi sequel “The Wandering Earth II.”
From left, Wu Jing, Wang Zhi and Kawawa Kadichi in a scene from the sci-fi sequel “The Wandering Earth II.”
From left, Wu Jing, Wang Zhi and Kawawa Kadichi in a scene from the sci-fi sequel “The Wandering Earth II.”

results.title: Page and Screen: Can You Guess This Author With a Flair for Thrillers?
results.abstract: This writer’s work kept readers — and moviegoers — on edge for decades. Who is it?

results.title: Julian Sands Is Reported Missing on Mountain Hike in California
results.abstract: The search for Mr. Sands, a British actor known for the 1986 film “A Room With a View” and other roles, is an avid trail hiker. His disappearance follows weeks of devastating weather across California.
results.byline: By Derrick Bryson Taylor and Johnny Diaz

multimedia.caption: The actor Julian Sands in 2013, in Beverly Hills, Calif.
The actor Julian Sands in 2013, in Beverly Hills, Calif.
The actor Julian Sands in 2013, in Beverly Hills, Calif.

results.title: ‘In From the Side’ Review: Love and Rugby Play a Losing Game
results.abstract: In Matt Carter’s gay rugby film, sports and romance smash together like two players from opposing teams.

multimedia.caption: Alexander King, left, and Alexander Lincoln in “In From the Side.”
Alexander King, left, and Alexander Lincoln in “In From the Side.”
Alexander King, left, and Alexander Lincoln in “In From the Side.”

results.title: ‘New Gods: Yang Jian’ Review: ‘Cowboy Bebop’ Without the Bop
results.abstract: In this animated fantasy, a former deity must confront his traumatic past if he hopes to find absolution and save the world.

multimedia.caption: Light Chaser Animation Studios’ graphics enliven the otherworldly fight sequences in “New Gods: Yang Jian.”
Light Chaser Animation Studios’ graphics enliven the otherworldly fight sequences in “New Gods: Yang Jian.”

results.title: ‘The Last Autumn’ Review: The Majesty of Shepherds
results.abstract: This observational documentary about an aging farming couple on the Icelandic coast unfolds like an elegy to a life lived off the land.

multimedia.caption: “The Last Autumn,” from the director Yrsa Roca Fannberg, follows a couple on the Icelandic coast as they prepare for the annual autumnal ritual of herding their sheep down the mountain.
“The Last Autumn,” from the director Yrsa Roca Fannberg, follows a couple on the Icelandic coast as they prepare for the annual autumnal ritual of herding their sheep down the mountain.

results.title: ‘When You Finish Saving the World’ Review: Mother and Son Disunion
results.abstract: Julianne Moore plays a parent to a son (Finn Wolfhard) with whom she fails to see eye-to-eye in this comedy directed by Jesse Eisenberg.

results.abstract: This thriller, about a teenage girl whose mother disappears, plays out on a computer screen.

results.title: Alec Baldwin Will Be Charged With Involuntary Manslaughter in ‘Rust’ Killing
results.abstract: A gun that Mr. Baldwin was rehearsing with went off, killing the film’s cinematographer. The armorer responsible for weapons on set also faces manslaughter charges.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Graham Bowley

results.title: ‘All Eyes Off Me’ Review: Scenes of Seduction
results.abstract: A series of sexual and social situations unspool in this portrait of Israeli youth culture.

multimedia.caption: Elisheva Weil and Leib Lev Levin in “All Eyes Off Me.”
Elisheva Weil and Leib Lev Levin in “All Eyes Off Me.”
Elisheva Weil and Leib Lev Levin in “All Eyes Off Me.”

results.title: India’s Love Story With a Movie Still on the Big Screen After 27 Years
results.abstract: ‘D.D.L.J.,’ which a Mumbai theater has shown nearly every day since 1995, encapsulates a society in churn, with the choices afforded by economic opportunity clashing with tradition.
results.byline: By Mujib Mashal, Suhasini Raj and Atul Loke

multimedia.caption: A woman who goes by the name Simran has become a regular at screenings of “Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge” at the Maratha Mandir cinema in Mumbai.

results.title: Prosecutors to Announce Whether They Plan Charges in ‘Rust’ Case
results.abstract: More than a year after the fatal shooting, Santa Fe County prosecutors said they would announce on Thursday whether anyone would be charged in the case.

multimedia.caption: The district attorney for Santa Fe County, N.M., wrote last year that up to four people could be charged in connection with the fatal shooting on the “Rust” movie set.

results.title: ‘The Ability to Say Yes’ to Stories Long Neglected on the Screen
results.abstract: People of color are financing a number of movies at the Sundance Film Festival focused on elevating underrepresented voices.

results.title: ‘Virtually Heroes’ Review: Game Over, Man
results.abstract: After a decade on the shelf, this action comedy is streaming for the first time. But while the action is dated, the comedy is antique.

results.title: A Rosier View of Roald Dahl
results.abstract: “Teller of the Unexpected,” an elegant new biography, sidesteps the ugly side of the children’s book author while capturing his grandiose, tragedy-specked life.

results.abstract: Starring Jessica Lange and Ed Harris, Jonathan Kent’s adaptation of “Long Day’s Journey Into Night” started production, only to lose key financing.

results.title: For the Documentarian Alice Diop, Only Fiction Could Do Justice to a Tragedy
results.abstract: “Saint Omer” borrows details from a case of infanticide in France, which the director found raised profound but very personal issues.

multimedia.caption: “There is no doubt that the process of going through this film is something that healed me,” Alice Diop, the director of “Saint Omer,” said.
multimedia.copyright: Evelyn Freja for The New York Times

results.title: Older Moviegoers Turn Out for ‘A Man Called Otto’
results.abstract: Ticket sales totaled $15 million over the holiday weekend, fueled by older audiences in the middle of the country.

multimedia.caption: Crowds showed up for “A Man Called Otto” in cities like Detroit, Minneapolis, Denver and Salt Lake City. None of the top 75 theaters for the film were in Los Angeles or New York.
Crowds showed up for “A Man Called Otto” in cities like Detroit, Minneapolis, Denver and Salt Lake City. None of the top 75 theaters for the film were in Los Angeles or New York.

results.title: Gina Lollobrigida, Movie Star and Sex Symbol, Is Dead at 95
results.abstract: She began her career in her native Italy, and although she achieved fame in America, she worked more often in Europe. She later had a second career as an artist and filmmaker.

multimedia.caption: Gina Lollobrigida in the 1953 Italian-French comedy “Fanfan la Tulipe.” A year after it was released in the United States, she was on the cover of Time magazine.
Gina Lollobrigida in the 1953 Italian-French comedy “Fanfan la Tulipe.” A year after it was released in the United States, she was on the cover of Time magazine.
